entry.title: For Orchestra
entry.content: So I was listening to Scott Mills on BBC Radio 1 today and he was playing a few songs from For Orchestra by Walt Ribeiro. Some cool orchestral versions of songs you might know.

entry.title: Instagram
entry.content:
I love Instagram :) I need to take more photos tho, just be more creative.

I've come across two sites since they released their API that do some cool things.

The first is Insta Goodies "Stickers of your Instagram photos!" hence the reason I need to take more photos.

The next is Instagrid - "A Clean Web Gallery For Your Instagram Photos", this is because there isn't an easy way on the web to see all your photos, you can scan through your feed on the iPhone app but it's small etc. Hopefully more things will become available soon or make your own using the API!

Edit: Hatchcraft - BOO BOX – bamboo shadow box frames for your photos and art @Hatchcraft - Twitter

entry.title: Syntax Hightling Update
entry.content: So I've added a theme switcher to the syntax highlighting on the 599 pages and maybe other coding pages later, took a theme switcher I'd used from a magazine tutorial from a while back. Need to style it so it looks better but its functional.

entry.title: Code Highlighting
entry.content: I've started making more tutorials and putting them up on here. I was using a crude method of divs and classes to highlight different code which looked ok but I'd seen it looks much better on other sites so I went looking and found Syntax Highlighter which does an amazing job. I've used it on My Twitter integration tutorial locally and a quick hosted demo. I think it makes the page look a lot better. I'm gonna add it to my 599CD Classroom, hopefully in the next couple of days.

entry.title: Project List
entry.content: Just added a new page with the Web Projects I'm working on, should be an expanding list :)

entry.title: Quotes
entry.content: Misquotations are the only quotations that are never misquoted." - Hesketh Pearson

entry.title: CSS3
entry.content: Just seen a video by Think Vitamin and they showed a cool example of the border-radius and transitions (Only in Chrome or Safari) Also cool text Check this out in Safari!

entry.title: My First Post
entry.content: Hi All, I've decided to start a blog, yes I could have added one by another company but thought I’d create my own for training/learning principles etc.

entry.title: RSS Feeds
entry.content: I've added RSS Feeds for this blog, the Music list and the film list They are all separate so you add only the ones you wish, if you want to.
